title: Why is financial education not an important part of the school curriculum? - Quora

response.answer_text: Come to my maths classes and you will get an introduction to understanding money. A full financial education is a university course. On my own case, I learned about finance (and a shortage of it) from my parents. I helped dad with the books for his business, understood something about taxation, borrowing and investing. But some parents neglect this, and so students expect schools to provide it.
